Summary Mark Rivera has a PhD from the Kellogg School of Management. His research draws from sociology, social-psychology, and statistical physics to understand how people form social networks and how these connections affect creativity, achievement, and job-satisfaction for people and for organizations. 
 
Mark has taught classes on Management, Social Networks, & Negotiations at the Kellogg School of Management and has lectured and consulted on the use of Social Network Data at Zynga, Google, a fortune 500 consumer goods manufacturer, IDEO and the Stanford Graduate School of Business. Specialties:Data analysis, Social Network Theory and Methodologies, Survey Design and Implementation, Electronic Data Processing, Complex Systems Theory. Summary Scott Milagro-Fotré is a research professional, internal consultant, and subject matter expert in user experience and survey design. He is trained in biostatistics, new social media, and health policy.  
 
Scott is passionate about technology, politics, diversity and social justice initiatives. He has proven his skills in a variety of different work environments and has successful work experiences in Europe, Central America, and southwestern and east Africa. Managed the creation of operational success metrics for scaled user support covering 1-to-1 emails, help center, and community forums. 
 
Project managed agent productivity metrics and service level agreements for YouTube’s remote vendor operations in Hyderabad, India. 
 
Developed YouTube’s first international user support operations reporting detailing support metrics and top product issues across 45+ language markets. 
 
Launched YouTube’s top fixes program, a cross functional initiative targeting the most egregious product errors. National Product Strategy Lead - LGBT Ad Initiative Google September 2011  –  January 2015  (3 years 5 months) Mountain View, CA Actively developed Google’s advertising strategy targeting the LGBT consumer. 
 
Organized an initiative to get LGBT owned businesses online and using Google products. 
 
Trained the AdSense team on including messaging around LGBT consumers to a targeted list of LGBT 
friendly companies. Leader, LGBT Employee Resource Group (Bay Area) Google November 2009  –  June 2014  (4 years 8 months) Mountain View, CA Coordinated the largest corporate contingent in San Francisco Pride history, with 600+ Google employees marching with their friends and family. 
 
Raised over $2,200 to benefit the National Center for Lesbian Rights. 
 
Official Google representative at national events hosted by the Human Rights Campaign, the Trevor Project, 
the National Center for Lesbian Rights, and Equality California. 
 
Organized the Google “It Gets Better Video” which has reached over 837,000 viewers on YouTube. 
 
Collaborated with the Google online store to make LGBT themed Android t-shirts for sale to the public. User Insights Strategist Google April 2012  –  June 2012  (3 months) Dublin, Ireland Lead user feedback specialist supporting the European, Middle Eastern, and African markets for a Q2 rotation. 
 
Developing the process to integrate international user feedback across multiple language markets into the quarterly selection of top user issues escalated to Product and Engineering. 
 
Coordinating implementation of non-English language clustering for an internal user feedback analysis tool. 
 
Designing an internal tool to apply a unified taxonomy across user submitted issues to better triage bug 
escalations. User Insights Strategist Google February 2011  –  March 2012  (1 year 2 months) Mountain View, CA Lead user feedback specialist supporting the Product and Engineering teams for Maps, Maps for Mobile, Map Maker, Street View, Earth, and SketchUp. 
 
Supported the Product and Engineering teams during product updates and feature launches by providing metrics on product usage trends, user feedback, and major bugs. Notable launches include Street View Belgium; Map Maker US, Canada, and France; Earth 6.2; Maps for Mobile 6.5; and SketchUp M2. 
 
Conducted deep dive statistical analyses to better understand user behavior resulting in notable bug fixes for Google Earth installation errors, Maps directions errors, and Street View privacy escalations. 
 
Developed a survey delivered to 300,000+ users in 20 languages to measure Street View feature level satisfaction leading to the implementation of user feedback into an upcoming version of the product. 
 
Co-led the modification of a Happiness Tracking Survey, delivered to 2% of the Maps userbase, to more specifically define top pain points resulting in higher quality bug submissions. 
 
Revamped and automated the methodology for tracking and reporting Engineering accountable bugs to senior management resulting in more efficient process monitoring for the Consumer Operations department. Volunteer HIV Counselor Magnet May 2009  –  May 2011  (2 years 1 month) San Francisco, CA • California State Certified HIV/STI test counselor and lab technician People Analyst Google November 2009  –  February 2011  (1 year 4 months) Mountain View, CA Lead analyst for the organizational planning horizontal serving Engineering, Product, Sales and General & Administrative. 
 
Spearheaded an analysis on title inflation/deflation and alternative title framework strategies as part of a special request from Google’s Operating Committee. 
 
Conceptualized, designed, and implemented a self-service, organizational planning tool to forecast organizational shape one year into the future. 
 
Simplified the promotions process utilizing organizational planning and population metrics analyses to impact decision making at the executive level. Project Coordinator / Statistician UCSF, Center for AIDS Prevention Studies June 2008  –  November 2009  (1 year 6 months) San Francisco, CA Project coordinator for a rapid assessment of HIV voluntary counseling and testing (VCT) on three military bases 
in Namibia. 
 
Interviewed and performed rapid assessment of HIV VCT coordinators, senior military officers, HIV/AIDS NGO directors, and senior management at the Namibian Ministries of Defense, Health, and Social Services. 
 
Authored internal review board, scope of work, and informed consent documents, interview guides, and final stakeholder report. 
 
Project coordinator for a randomized clinical trial of TB/HIV co-infection integrated VCT in Kampala, Uganda. 
 
Developed models using SAS 9.1 for predicting willingness to consent to HIV testing. 
 
Monitored on-site counseling and testing performance quality in TB clinics and patient home visits. Policy Intern Office of the Mayor June 2009  –  September 2009  (4 months) San Francisco, CA Submitted a policy proposal detailing nutritional standards for vending machines on city property. 
 
Collaborated with state and regional food and nutrition experts to gain support for the healthy vending policy. 
 
Lobbied for approval of the healthy vending policy from the San Francisco Food Policy Council. Assistant Statistician UCSF, Center for AIDS Prevention Studies May 2007  –  August 2007  (4 months) San Francisco, CA Principal statistician at the evaluation center for a 15 site DHHS Special Project of National Significance. 
 
Developed time series analysis to forecast clinician uptake of intervention mechanism from baseline. 
 
Wrote the methods and results sections for two peer-reviewed journal articles detailing HIV prevention 
initiatives among American women.
